clinical_study.official_title: Level of DNA Methylation in People With Urothelial Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: Many studies previously showed the significant association between urinary arsenic profiles and urothelial carcinoma (UC) risk and observed the increased UC risk in people with lower plasma folate and higher homocysteine than those with higher plasma folate and lower homocysteine. The investigators would expect to explore the interactions among global DNA methylation, one-carbon metabolic pathway factors, urinary arsenic profiles and UC.

primary_outcome.description: Pathological verification of UC was done by routine urological practice including endoscopic biopsy or surgical resection of urinary tract tumors followed by histopathological examination by board-certified pathologists.

arm_group.description: Age and gender matched control subjects with no evidence of UC or any other malignancy were accrued from the hospital, recruiting people receiving adult health examinations at China Medical University Hospital.

study_pop.textblock: This is a hospital-based case-control study. Patients with urothelial carcinoma are recruited by pathological verification of UC was done by routine urological practice including endoscopic biopsy or surgical resection of urinary tract tumors followed by histopathological examination by board-certified pathologists. Healthy controls without evidence of UC or any other malignancy were recruited including those receiving adult health examinations at China Medical University Hospital.
